resources.string:
\n
Lie on the bench with your eyes under the bar. \n
Grab the bar with a medium grip-width. \n
Unrack the bar by straightening your arms. \n
Lower the bar to your mid-chest. \n
Press the bar back up until your arms are straight.

\n
Choose weights that allow you to maintain proper form \n
Lie on an exercise mat to do floor flies. \n
Use a flat bench for more range of motion doing lying chest flies. \n
Do standing dumbbell flies. \n
Adjust your bench to a 45-degree angle to do inclined flies

\n
Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbell at a shoulder-width grip \n
curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. \n
Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. \n
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in. \n
Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

\n
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. \n
Place your hands behind your head so your thumbs are behind your ears. \n
Hold your elbows out to the sides but rounded slightly in. \n
Tilt your chin slightly, leaving a few inches of space between your chin and your chest. \n
Gently pull your abdominals inward.

\n
Stand with your mid-foot under the barbelL \n
Bend over and grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip \n
Bend your knees until your shins touch the bar \n
Lift your chest up and straighten your lower back \n
Take a big breath, hold it, and stand up with the weight

\n
Step onto the machine facing the monitor \n
Begin pedaling to turn it on.. \n
Start pedaling at an even pace.. \n
Do not lock your knees. \n
Turn up the resistance

\n
Pick up the dumbbells. \n
Bend your elbows slightly. \n
Lift the dumbbell \n
Lift the dumbbells with your palms out.

\n
Sit at a lat pulldown station and grab the bar \n
Your arms should be completely straight and your torso upright. \n
ull your shoulder blades down and back \n
bring the bar to your chest \n
Pause, then slowly return to the starting position.

\n
Start in a standing position. \n
Take a big step forward with your right leg. \n
Lower your body until your right knee is at a 90-degree angle. \n
Push yourself upwards with your right foot. \n
Repeat the forward lunge.

\n
Position your elbows directly beneath your shoulders. \n
Make and maintain a straight body line from head to heels. \n
Squeeze your butt and the fronts of your thighs. \n
Brace your abs like youâ€™re going to take a punch. \n
Advance the exercise.

\n
Stand straight with feet hip-width apart \n
Tighten your stomach muscles. \n
Lower down, as if sitting \n
Straighten your legs \n
Repeat the movement

\n
Warm up for 5 minutes. \n
Keep a pace between 3 and 4 mph (4.8 and 6.4 km/h) for 20 minutes \n
Cool down for 5 minutes, by slowly lowering your pace each minute. \n
Experiment with inclines and faster speeds after the first 1 to 2 weeks
